terms.definition: Standard Operating Procedure - a detailed, written instruction to achieve uniformity in the performance of a specific function or process
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to see revision history and revert to previous versions
Good Manufacturing Practice - a system of quality assurance ensuring products are consistently produced and controlled according to quality standards
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted by a provider and accessed via the internet
A feature that allows multiple users to simultaneously edit and collaborate on the same document in real-time
A security approach that restricts system access to authorized users based on their role within an organization
Documents that are properly organized, maintained, and accessible to meet regulatory inspection requirements
The process of transferring knowledge, processes, or technologies from one department or organization to another
The collection and evaluation of data to establish scientific evidence that a process consistently produces results meeting predetermined specifications
Failure Mode and Effects Analysis - a systematic method for evaluating processes to identify potential failure modes and their impact
Groups of people with different functional expertise working toward a common goal
The process of ensuring that an organization adheres to laws, regulations, guidelines, and specifications relevant to its business
The process of increasing production from small-scale laboratory or pilot operations to full commercial manufacturing
A software system used to track, manage, and store documents and reduce paper usage in organizations
